abstracts.cdata!:
The Hazara Forestry Pre-Investment
            Project in Pakistan was achieved. The Bank amended the
            single stage feasibility study approach and introduced
            resource assessment as an initial phase. At appraisal the
            sequence between resource assessment and the design of the
            industrial feasibility study should be acknowledged and
            hence formulation of a detailed industrial feasibility study
            aiming at a specific development target (pulp mill) should
            be avoided. Research responsibility should not be given to
            the project unit which was neither equipped nor interested
            in this specific field. Instead, the research program should
            be made an integral part of the Pakistan Forest( PFI)
            program. The appointment process of consultants should have
            started soon after appraisal and appointments confirmed
            before credit effectiveness. The fact that the nature of the
            project changed considerably during implementation, due to
            the finding that resources were insufficient to support a
            pulpmill, should be seen as a positive step since the
            establishment of a pulpmill would have been uneconomic. The
            supervision missions which insisted on further assessments
            of the resource base should be credited for that approach.
